intro: Cybianthus pittierianus, commonly known as the Pittier's cybianthus, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
